ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Criminal Law& Mass Atrocity is a great course for anyone who wants to learn more about international criminal law, transitional justice and the problems of peace and justice in post conflict states. I would recommend it to anyone who has the time to really dive into it but not to someone looking for a fourth or fifth class. The workload gets heavy.
A demanding yet rewarding class. Not for the light hearted.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Crim Law& Mass Atrocity has made me much more aware of the tensions between peace and justice in post-conflict societies (but that they are not necessarily mutually independent), which will greatly benefit me when working in conflict resolution and peace building.
This course was fundmental in shaping my academic interests and ambitions.It transformed my views of criminal trials and their role in mass atrocity.
